section.title: Overview
section.para:
Auth Identity module provides functionalities for securely identifying originators of SIP messages. This module has two basic service:
authorizer - authorizes a message and adds Identity and Identity-Info headers
verifier - verifies an authorized message
Known limitations in this version:

listitem.para: authorizer and verifier support only SIP requests except for CANCEL and REGISTER
verifier does not support the subjectAltName extension of certificates

section.title: Dependencies
section.para: This module does not depend any other module.

section.title: Compilation
section.para:
This module needs the following headers and libraries:
OpenSSL for cryptographic functions
libcURL for HTTP, HTTPS functions

section.title: Installation And Running
section.para: Authorizer service needs an opportunity to make the public key, which conveyed in a certificate, available over HTTPS or HTTP for verifiers. The domain the authorizer is responsible for and the domain part of the URL of the certificate must be the same. This service needs its private key too.

section.title: privatekey_path (string)
section.para: The path of private key of the authentication service. The key must be in PEM format.
This parameter is required by authentication service.

section.title: certificate_path (string)
section.para: The path of certificate of the authentication service. The certificate must be in PEM format.
This parameter is required by authentication service.

section.title: certificate_url (string)
section.para: The url where certificate is available for other verifier services. (value of Identity-info header) The certificate should be in DER format.
This parameter is required by authentication service.

section.title: msg_timeout (integer)
section.para: If the Date header of message which is needed to be authenticated contains a time different by more than this seconds from the current time noted by the authentication service then it rejects the message.
This parameter is optional. The default value is "600".

If a message, the auth service should authorize, contains Date header then this function checks whether it falls in message timeout (set by msg_timeout parameter). If there is not any Date header then adds one. This function also checks whether the certificate of auth service (set by certificate_path parameter) has not been expired.

section.title: Dependencies
section.para: No dependencies

Assembles digest-string from the message, calculates its SHA1 hash, encrypt it with the private key (set by privatekey_path parameter) of authorizer service, base64 encodes it and adds to the outgoing message as the value of Identity header. This function also adds Identity-Info header which contains an URI (set by certificate_url parameter) from which the certificate of auth service can be acquired.

para.emphasis: Note: this function needs the final outgoing message for authorization, so no module may modify any digest string related headers (From, To, Call-ID, CSeq, Date, Contact) and body after auth_add_identity()'s been called

section.title: Dependencies
section.para: auth_date_proc() must be called before

section.title: Authorizer service examples
auth_validity_time (integer)
section.para: The validity time of an authenticated message. The message will be refused if it contains a time different by more than this seconds from the current time noted by the verification service.
This parameter is optional. The default value is "3600".

section.title: callid_cache_limit (integer)
section.para: The number of Call-IDs stored in order to recognize call replay attacks. A Call-ID is stored auth_validity_time long and uses approximately 100 bytes memory.
This parameter is optional. The default value is "32768". (you should increase the size of shared memory with -m command line switch if you liked to store more callid than 10000)

section.title: certificate_cache_limit (integer)
section.para: The number of certificates stored in order to avoid needless download. A certificate is stored until its expiration date and uses approximately 600 bytes memory.
This parameter is optional. The default value is "4096".

section.title: cainfo_path (string)
section.para: A file of trusted certificates. The file should contain multiple certificates in PEM format concatenated together. It could be useful for verifying a certificate not signed by a trusted CA.
This parameter is optional. It has not got default value.
Checks Date header of the incoming message whether falls in validity time (set by auth_validity_time parameter)

section.title: Dependencies
section.para: No dependencies

Tries to get certificate defined by the value of Identity-info header from certificate table (which size is set by certificate_cache_limit parameter). If the required certificate is not found there then this function downloads it.

section.title: Dependencies
section.para: No dependencies
Checks whether the downloaded certificate is valid (is not expired, its subject and the domain part of the URL are the same) and adds it to certificate table.

section.title: Dependencies
section.para: vrfy_get_certificate() must be called before
Assembles digest-string from the message, create SHA1 hash and compares it with the decrypted value of Identity header.

section.title: Dependencies
section.para: vrfy_get_certificate() must be called before and vrfy_check_certificate() should be called before

Checks whether the current call's been already processed in validity time (set by auth_validity_time) to recognize call replay attacks. If this call (identified by Call-id, Cseq, and tag of From header triple) has not been replayed then adds it to callid table (which size is set by callid_cache_limit parameter).

section.title: Dependencies
section.para: This function should be called for the last time.
